page.title: 08BIRD LIFE IN SEAHAM
page.content: THERE ARE MANY DIFFERENT TYPES OF BIRDS IN AND AROUND SEAHAM.SOME COME TO OUR GARDENS AND WE SEE OTHERS IN THE PARKS AND AT THE SEASIDE.I'VE EVEN SEEN A KESTREL ON MY TELEVISION AERIAL.IT IS A BIRD OF PREY.THERE ARE CROWS IN THE TREES IN THE PARK.AT SCHOOL MY CLASS HAD A FEEDING STATION IN THE GARDEN LAST WINTER.WE SAW BLUETITS,GREATTITS,CHAFFINCHES , SPARROWS,THRUSHES,BLACKBIRDS,ROBINS AND EVEN THE SEAGULLS AND PIGEONS CAME TO EAT.AT NIGHT WE SOMETIMES HEAR AN OWL HOOTING.IN THE SUMMER THE HOUSE MARTENS BUILD THEIR NESTS IN THE EAVES OF MY HOUSE.WE ENJOY OBSERVING AND IDENTIFYING ALL THESE BIRDS.SOME CHILDREN COLLECT BIRDS EGGS EVEN THOUGH IT IS ILLEGAL.THERE ARE HEAVY FINES FOR TAKING THE EGGS OF BIRDS OF PREY OR THOSE OF RARE BIRDS.
